triples.name: Language model
triples.relevance: The paper investigates what knowledge pretrained language models learn and how to extract it effectively.

triples.name: Cloze test
triples.relevance: The paper reformulates tasks as fill-in-the-blanks problems using cloze tests to gauge model knowledge.

triples.name: Gradient descent
triples.relevance: AutoPrompt uses gradient-guided search to automatically generate prompts for language models.

triples.name: BERT (language model)
triples.relevance: The paper uses masked language models (like BERT) to perform tasks without additional parameters or finetuning.

triples.name: Sentiment analysis
triples.relevance: The paper demonstrates that MLMs can perform sentiment analysis with automatically generated prompts.

triples.name: Textual entailment
triples.relevance: The paper shows MLMs can perform natural language inference (textual entailment) with AutoPrompt.

triples.name: Relationship extraction
triples.relevance: The paper demonstrates MLMs can be used as relation extractors more effectively than supervised models.

triples.name: Fine-tuning (deep learning)
triples.relevance: AutoPrompt provides a parameter-free alternative to finetuning, potentially replacing it for some tasks.
